alert.note: Alert for Kent; Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:53PM EST until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut...Rhode Island... Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. Pawtuxet River At Cranston affecting Providence and Kent Counties. For the Farmington River...including Simsbury...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Pawtuxet River...including Cranston...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pawtuxet River at Cranston. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.5 feet, Evacuations are likely near the Pawtuxet river in Warwick and Cranston. Both homes and businesses will be impacted from this flood event. Businesses and homes will be impacted on streets including but not limited to the following, in Warwick, Pioneer Avenue, Bellows Street, Venturi Avenue and River Street. In Cranston, Wellington Avenue and Avery Road. In West Warwick, Daisy Street, the lower ends of Canna, Begonia and Aster Streets, and portions of Providence Street to Route 2. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 PM EST Monday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 PM EST Monday was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.0 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.7 feet on 10/15/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at noon EST.
